entries.meaning: A fabric or structure of fibrous elements attached to each other at regular intervals.

examples: A network of roads crisscrossed the country.

entries.meaning: A directory of people maintained for their advancement
examples: To get a job in today's economy, it is important to have a strong network.

entries.meaning: (broadcasting) A group of affiliated television stations that broadcast common programs from a parent company.
examples: TV back then was five channels (three networks, PBS, and an independent station that ran I Love Lucy reruns), […]

entries.meaning: (computing, Internet) Multiple computers and other devices connected together to share information
examples: The copy machine is connected to the network so it can now serve as a printer.

verbs.description: network (third-person singular simple present networks, present participle networking, simple past and past participle networked)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To interact socially for the purpose of getting connections or personal advancement.
examples: Many people find it worthwhile to network for jobs and information.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To connect two or more computers or other computerized devices.
examples: If we network his machine to the server, he will be able to see all the files.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To interconnect a group or system.
(transitive, broadcasting) To broadcast across an entire network of stations and affiliates at the same time.
